purpleculture_pinyin:
gǎn
stick; pole; lever; classifier for long objects such as guns
палка; столб; рычаг; классификатор для длинных предметов, таких как пистолеты
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 杆)
Pictophonetic: 旱 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 桿菌 [ gǎn jūn ]: bacillus (any rod-shaped bacteria)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 旱 [ hàn ] dry; drought; desert
heisig_chinese_memo: The shaft tree is a special tree that, during a drought, you can find a hole in its shaft and stick a straw in to suck water out.
Ru_trainchinese:
gǎn: (сч.слово) счетное слово для флагов, ручек или пистолетов
gǎn: (сущ) ручка, рычаг, стержень, ось
gān: (сущ) полюс, палка, столб, шест
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To stay dry when the rain comes you have to stand close to the main shaft of the tree (the trunk).
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " wood ", " dry " sound. " Dry " and " dry " sound the same, so " stroke " and " stroke " are connected. The original meaning is long wooden stick, wooden stick. "Zhengzitong": "Pole, vulgar pole character." Jin Dong Jieyuan's "Xixiang Ji Zhugong Tune" Volume 1: "If you don't talk about Piao Dao Bang Bang, long spear Da Ma." "Piao Dao", "Pole Bang", "Long Spear" "They are all weapons. The author uses this sentence to explain that "West Chamber" is a love story, and the content has nothing to do with the martial arts story of "Piao Daoganbang". It also extended to refer to slender things made of wood or metal that have certain uses, such as flagpoles and telephone poles; Ming Luo Guanzhong's "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" second episode: "(Dian) Wei dismounted, drank the army, and held the flagpole with one hand. Stand in the wind.” It also refers to the elongated objects on the utensils, such as pens and guns. Song Zenggongliang "The General Principles of Wujing. Volume 13": "Short-bladed gun and hakama two feet long, and the rod is six feet long." " Hakama " is the part that connects the blade and the barrel; it means that the blade and hakama of the short-bladed gun are two feet long, and the barrel is long. Six feet.

Bronze writing is used as the original meaning. Zihezi Kettle: "Build a rod and smash the kettle." That is, place a wooden stick (in the kettle) to reduce the volume (capacity) of the kettle.

" Rod " can also be used to describe rod-shaped things, the most common is "bacillus", that is, rod-shaped bacteria, such as: Escherichia coli, Helicobacter pylori.
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from " wood ", " dry " sound. " Dry " and " dry " sound the same, so " stroke " and " stroke " are connected. The original meaning is long wooden stick, wooden stick.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「木」，「旱」聲。「旱」與「干」聲同，故「桿」與「杆」相通。本義是長木棍、木棒。《正字通》：「桿，俗杆字。」金董解元《西廂記諸宮調》卷一：「話兒不提朴刀桿棒，長槍大馬。」「朴刀」、「桿棒」、「長槍」都是武器，作者以這句說明《西廂記》是一個愛情故事，內容與「朴刀桿棒」的武俠故事沒有關係。又引申泛指有一定用途的木頭或金屬製成的細長東西，如旗桿、電線桿；明羅貫中《三國演義》第二回：「（典）韋下馬，喝退眾軍，一手執定旗桿，立於風中。」亦引申指器物上的細長東西，如筆桿、槍桿。宋曾公亮《武經總要．卷十三》：「短刃槍并袴長貳尺，桿長六尺。」「袴」是連接槍刃和槍桿的部分；意指短刃槍的槍刃和袴共長兩尺，槍桿長六尺。

　　金文用作本義。子禾子釜：「築桿烕釜。」即（在釜內）放置木棒，以減少釜的量值（容量）。

　　「桿」又可用作形容桿狀的東西，最常見的是「桿菌」，即是桿狀的細菌，例如：大腸桿菌、幽門螺桿菌。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「木」，「旱」聲。「旱」與「干」聲同，故「桿」與「杆」相通。本義是長木棍、木棒。

HSK: 6
Chinese: The shaft tree is a special tree that, during a drought, you can find a hole in its shaft and stick a straw in to suck water out.
Meaning: shaft
Hanzi: 杆
Story: To stay dry when the rain comes you have to stand close to the main shaft of the tree (the trunk).
Kind: traditional

金文從「 木 」，「 旱 」聲。「 旱 」與「 干 」聲同，故「 桿 」與「 杆 」相通。本義是長木棍、木棒。《正字通》：「桿，俗杆字。」金董解元《西廂記諸宮調》卷一：「話兒不提朴刀桿棒，長槍大馬。」「朴刀」、「桿棒」、「長槍」都是武器，作者以這句說明《西廂記》是一個愛情故事，內容與「朴刀桿棒」的武俠故事沒有關係。又引申泛指有一定用途的木頭或金屬製成的細長東西，如旗桿、電線桿；明羅貫中《三國演義》第二回：「（典）韋下馬，喝退眾軍，一手執定旗桿，立於風中。」亦引申指器物上的細長東西，如筆桿、槍桿。宋曾公亮《武經總要．卷十三》：「短刃槍并袴長貳尺，桿長六尺。」「 袴 」是連接槍刃和槍桿的部分；意指短刃槍的槍刃和袴共長兩尺，槍桿長六尺。 金文用作本義。子禾子釜：「築桿烕釜。」即（在釜內）放置木棒，以減少釜的量值（容量）。 「 桿 」又可用作形容桿狀的東西，最常見的是「桿菌」，即是桿狀的細菌，例如：大腸桿菌、幽門螺桿菌。

"Zhengzitong": "Pole, vulgar pole character." Jin Dong Jieyuan's "Xixiang Ji Zhugong Tune" Volume 1: "If you don't talk about Piao Dao Bang Bang, long spear Da Ma." "Piao Dao", "Pole Bang", "Long Spear" "They are all weapons. The author uses this sentence to explain that "West Chamber" is a love story, and the content has nothing to do with the martial arts story of "Piao Daoganbang". It also extended to refer to slender things made of wood or metal that have certain uses, such as flagpoles and telephone poles; Ming Luo Guanzhong's "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" second episode: "(Dian) Wei dismounted, drank the army, and held the flagpole with one hand. Stand in the wind.” It also refers to the elongated objects on the utensils, such as pens and guns. Song Zenggongliang "The General Principles of Wujing. Volume 13": "Short-bladed gun and hakama two feet long, and the rod is six feet long." " Hakama" is the part that connects the blade and the barrel; it means that the blade and hakama of the short-bladed gun are two feet long, and the barrel is long. Six feet. Bronze writing is used as the original meaning. Zihezi Kettle: "Build a rod and smash the kettle." That is, place a wooden stick (in the kettle) to reduce the volume (capacity) of the kettle. " Rod" can also be used to describe rod-shaped things, the most common is "bacillus", that is, rod-shaped bacteria, such as: Escherichia coli, Helicobacter pylori.

桿
gǎn
同“杆2”。

桿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gān］
同“杆2”。
竿子。
[②]［gǎn］
同“杆3”。
(1)棍。
(2)量词。

桿字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　桿； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页527第23
【篇海】侯幹切，音汗。木也。【正字通】俗杆字。
